analyzed: dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  niyyānikaduka

original: Naniyyānikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naniyyāniko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.
analyzed: na niyyānikam dhammam paṭicca na niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: A non-leading-out idea is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a non-leading-out idea. … one …

original: Naaniyyānikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naaniyyāniko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na aniyyānikam dhammam paṭicca na aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: A non-leading-out idea is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a leading-out idea. … three …

original: Naniyyānikañca naaniyyānikañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naniyyāniko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na niyyānikam ca na aniyyānikam ca dhammam paṭicca na niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: A leading-out and a non-leading-out idea is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a leading-out idea. … one … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe vipāke ekam pe avigate pañca
translated: In the case of cause, there are five; in the case of object, there are two; … in the case of kamma result, there is one; … in the case of dissociation, there are five.
